answerText: second law of thermodynamics[10] In his axiomatic statement of the second law of thermodynamics, reading "In every neighborhood of any state S of an adiabatically enclosed system there are states inaccessible from S," this Greek scientist came up with the concept of adiabatic accessibility.

question: Question: The Kelvin-Planck statement of this law essentially says that it's impossible to achieve 100% efficiency with a heat engine [10] Identify this thermodynamic law which states that the entropy of an isolated system never decreases.
